thread.title: The struggle was real

author: news24.com
title: The struggle was real
text:
Year 2000, I got a tuition only scholarship at UCT. I had to sort my own Res and food.
I joined a troop of UCT poor kids in salt River, where we were staying 5 per room for R10 per day. We ate Pilchards for one and a half years every day. It was Pilchard Sandwich in the Morning and Lunch would be Pilchard with Pap or rice.
I only had normal food when I had time to dash to the soup kitchen in Cape Townâ€™s Wood stock area. We paid 5c for a food coupon there.
Later I got a job at the Water Front as a security guard to a fishing trawler that had a dispute with the Authorities.
